title: At least 25 killed , 50 wounded in Israeli strikes on tent camps near Rafah , Gaza health officials say
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip — Israeli forces shelled tent camps for displaced Palestinians outside Gaza’s southern city of Rafah on Friday, killing at least 25 people and wounding another 50, according to the territory’s health officials and emergency workers.
This was the latest deadly attack in the Gaza Strip, where hundreds of thousands have fled fighting between Israel and Hamas.
The locations of the attacks provided by the Civil Defense and the Red Cross hospital appear to be just outside an Israeli-designated safe zone on the Mediterranean coast, known as Muwasi.

The most recent security-related event that can be placed on a map is the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine. The war started on February 24, 2022, when Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a "special military operation" in Ukraine. The Russian forces entered the country from multiple fronts, including by land, sea, and air, with the stated goal of "demilitarizing" and "denazifying" Ukraine.

In response, the United States and several of its allies have imposed severe sanctions on Russia, including restrictions on its financial institutions, some individuals, and businesses, in an attempt to pressure Russia to halt the invasion. The United States and its allies have also provided financial and military aid to Ukraine, and deployed additional troops to the region, though they have not engaged in direct combat with Russian forces.

In early April, Russian forces withdrew from areas around the capital Kyiv, and are refocusing their offensive on the Donbas region in the east.

title: Reports in Syria : Air strike and explosions near the border with Iraq
message:
Arab-language media on Friday evening reported an air strike in Al Bukamal in Syria, located near the border with Iraq.
Al-Arabiya TV reported that the strike targeted what was described as “military headquarters”.
Syrian radio station Sham FM reported that the strike may have been an American air strike.
Earlier this month, an Iranian military adviser was killed in an alleged Israeli strike in the Aleppo region of Syria.
In May, Syrian media reported that eight Syrian soldiers were injured in air strikes that targeted a building in the Damascus area and which were attributed to Israel.

message:
Yemen has released a video showing its Tufan-1 (also written Toofan-1) uncrewed surface vessel (USV), or drone boat, blowing apart a target vessel during a test.
The specifications of the USV used to attack the M/V Tutor are unclear.
The explosion that rippled into the M/V Tutor looked quite powerful though, as you can see below.
In response to the threat, the U.S. and its allies have gone on the offensive to hunt down Houthi USVs — as well as missiles and aerial drones — both before and after they are launched.
Despite this campaign, there appears to be no letup in the Houthi attacks, including the use of drone boats.

title: Man under police guard after allegedly stabbing security guards at western Sydney hospital
message:
A man remains under police guard at a western Sydney hospital after allegedly slashing and assaulting staff.
Police were called to Westmead hospital about 11.30pm on Friday after reports a man had assaulted several staff members.
A 29-year-old male nurse was injured in the attack, while a third security guard suffered a dislocated shoulder.
The man was arrested and remains under guard at the hospital.
The “senseless violence” on hospital staff was horrifying, the secretary of the Health Services Union NSW, Gerard Hayes, said.
event_breakdown:
Man slashes and assaults hospital staff at Westmead Hospital in western Sydney
Man arrested and remains under guard at hospital.

title: IDF strikes kill at least 45 Palestinians , drive new wave of displacement as Israel pushes into Rafah - 22 - Jun - 2024
message:
Israeli forces pounded Rafah in southern Gaza on Friday, as well as other areas across the enclave, killing at least 45 Palestinians as troops engaged in close-quarter combat with Hamas militants.
Elsewhere, Israeli forces continued a new push back into some Gaza City suburbs in Gaza's north, where they fought with Hamas-led militants.
Residents said the Israelis had destroyed many homes in the heart of Gaza City on Thursday.
Tens of thousands of Lebanese have also fled their homes following Israeli strikes against southern Lebanon.
Iran's mission to the United Nations said on Friday that Hezbollah had the capability to defend itself and Lebanon against Israel.

title: Israeli Strikes on Tent Camps Near Rafah Kill At Least 25 and Wound 50 , Gaza Health Officials Say
message:
Israeli forces shelled tent camps for displaced Palestinians outside Gaza’s southern city of Rafah on Friday, killing at least 25 people and wounding another 50, according to the territory’s health officials and emergency workers.
The locations of the attacks provided by the Civil Defense and the Red Cross hospital appear to be just outside an Israeli-designated safe zone on the Mediterranean coast, known as Muwasi.
The attack near the Red Cross hospital began with a munition that only made a loud bang and bright flash, said Mona Ashour, who lost her husband after he went to investigate what was happening.
“And then they hit with the second one, which was a little closer to the entrance of the Red Cross,” she said.
They struck the place twice.”The hospital’s location is known to all parties in the conflict and marked with the Red Cross emblem, the ICRC noted on Friday.

title: UN chief warns Lebanon must not become  another Gaza  as tensions rise
message:
UN chief warns Lebanon must not become 'another Gaza' as tensions riseIran Press TVFriday, 21 June 2024 6:25 PMUN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has warned against a wider conflict in West Asia after Israeli officials threatened to launch an invasion of Lebanon.
"I felt compelled today to voice my profound concerns about the escalation between Israel and Hezbollah along the Blue Line.
The top UN diplomat said the people of the region and the world cannot "afford Lebanon to become another Gaza."
On Tuesday, the Israeli army said it had approved plans for an attack on Lebanon, raising concerns that the regime might carry out threats that it will turn Lebanon into another Gaza.
Nasrallah emphasized that an incursion into the Galilee region remains an option on the table should Israel invade southern Lebanon.

title: Common Sense , Not Geography : Pentagon On Allowing Ukraine Strikes Into Russia
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Ukraine's are allowed to use missiles provided by the United States to hit targets inside Russia if the country is acting in self-defense, and the area of those strikes is not restricted to areas just across the border with Kharkiv region.
That's according to the Pentagon, AP reports.
Russia has been firing on Ukrainian targets from inside its border, treating its territory as a“safe zone,” said Pat Ryder, Pentagon press secretary.
In the previous move, the U.S. allowed Ukraine to fire donated missiles at targets located in the areas across the border.
The Pentagon said the additional permissions are not a new policy.

title: Ukraine Border Guards Engage Russian EW System , Artillery In Precision Strikes
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Ukrainian border guards operating in the Bakhmut axis destroyed two Russian artillery systems and an electronic warfare system, posting the relevant footage on social media.
The report comes from the force's press service , as seen by Ukrinform.
"In the direction of Bakhmut, fire support unit of the Pomsta brigade destroyed the invaders' EW station along with 105mm M101 howitzers," the statement reads.
Two enemy 122-mm D-30 howitzers were also destroyed with the use of attack drones operated by the Phoenix unit.
As Ukrinform reported earlier, Ukraine's Defense Forces hit three units of valuable Russian hardware, in particular the R-934B Sinitsa air defense system, the Murom-M monitoring system, and a Tor-M2 tactical anti-aircraft warfare system.
event_breakdown: Ukraine's border guards destroyed two Russian artillery systems and an electronic warfare system in the Bakhmut axis, one of them being a 122-mm D-30 howitzer.

title: EC - 37B Compass Call Electronic Warfare Aircraft , US
message:
The EA-37B (previously EC-37B) Compass Call electronic warfare (EW) aircraft is being developed to provide improved electronic attack capabilities for the US Air Force (USAF) based on the Gulfstream G550 commercial business jet.
It is equipped with the existing Compass Call EW system installed on the ageing Lockheed Martin-built EC-130H Compass Call electronic attack aircraft.
The EA-37B Compass Call aircraft will be delivered to the 55th Electronic Combat Group (ECG) located at Davis-Monthan Air Force Base in Tucson, Arizona.
EA-37B Compass Call EW aircraft developmentThe USAF announced its proposal to retire the existing fleet of EC-130H Compass Call aircraft from its service in 2014.
The Baseline 3 package provides more electronic warfare capabilities compared to the package installed in the EC-130H Compass Call aircraft.

title: Likely Yemen Houthi rebel attack targets ship in Gulf of Aden as Eisenhower reportedly heads home
message:
Meanwhile, U.S. officials reportedly ordered the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America’s response to the Houthi attacks, to return home.
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A commercial ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden saw explosions near the vessel, authorities said Saturday, likely the latest attack by Yemen’s Houthi rebels attempting to target the shipping lane.
The captain of the ship targeted late Friday saw “explosions in the vicinity of the vessel,” the British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The Houthis, who have held Yemen’s capital, Sanaa, since 2014, did not immediately claim the attack.
The Houthis have maintained that their attacks target ships linked to Israel, the United States or Britain.

title: States with traditional ties to Moscow exposed to misinformation
message:
Online misinformation has become a tactic to undermine democratic elections and this year’s European elections were no exception.
Without naming Cyprus, he noted that member states with traditional ties to Moscow are more exposed due to historical, cultural, religious, and economic links.
All Member States have a key role in its implementation as defence remains Member States’ competence.
Therefore, Member States that were more exposed to the consequences of the war became further targets.
These concerns especially Member States which have had traditional links to Russia – historic, cultural, religious, economic, etc.
event_breakdown:
1. Cyprus: The Cypriot government has accused Russia of orchestrating a misinformation campaign to undermine public trust in the country's political system and the upcoming presidential election. This comes after a Russian online troll farm targeted the island nation with fake social media accounts and fake news stories.
2. France: The European Parliament has warned that Russia is attempting to influence the upcoming elections in France, using a combination of online propaganda, cyberattacks, and "disinformation" to sway public opinion against the leading candidates. This comes just months after France was targeted by a Kremlin-linked hacking group during the 2017 presidential election.
3. United States: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has warned that Russia is continuing its efforts to meddle in U.S. elections, with the 2020 presidential race already in its crosshairs. This follows widespread allegations of Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election.
4. Ukraine: The country remains on edge as it braces for Russia's possible invasion, with fresh reports suggesting that the Kremlin is mobilizing troops near the border. This is the latest in a long line of escalations in the ongoing conflict between the two countries.

title: Palestinian Resistance Engages in Series of Operations against IOF
message:
The Palestinian Resistance conducted a wave of operations aimed at opposing the invading Israeli occupation forces, escalating tensions on Friday.
An array of Resistance factions, notably including Hamas’ al-Qassam Brigades and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad’s al-Quds Brigades, collectively engaged in defensive actions against the occupation forces.
The barrage expanded to include large-caliber shells fired as a response to the incursion of Israeli forces into Rafah.
Seizing the moment, al-Quds Brigades dramatically launched a salvo of rockets towards Kibbutz Be’eri, situated east of Gaza City.
Meanwhile, amidst the escalating resistance, the Israeli occupation forces intensified their bombing campaign against the Gaza Strip, prompting a swift response from the Palestine Red Crescent Society (PRCS).

title: Reports say Israeli shelling kills 25 in Gaza refugee tent camps | The Arkansas Democrat - Gazette
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip -- Israeli forces shelled tent camps for displaced Palestinians north of Gaza's southern city of Rafah on Friday, killing at least 25 people and wounding another 50, according to the territory's Health Ministry and emergency workers.
The locations of the attacks provided by the Civil Defense appear to be just outside an Israeli-designated safe zone.
Hasan al-Najjar said his sons were killed helping people who panicked after the first strike.
"My two sons went after they heard the women and children screaming," he said at the hospital.
At least 10 Palestinians were killed by Israeli fire elsewhere in the Gaza Strip on Friday.
event_breakdown:
Israeli forces killed at least 10 Palestinians near the southern border of the Gaza Strip on Friday, Health Ministry spokesman Ashraf al-Kidra said. According to military sources, seven were members of Hamas' armed wing. Israel media reported that the Israeli military had been thwarting an attack by Hamas for two days.
Israeli forces killed four Nahal Brigade soldiers – an elite unit in a regional brigade of the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) – in Gaza on Tuesday, the IDF announced Wednesday. Three other Israeli soldiers were wounded in the attack. All of the soldiers killed in the attack were from IDF's Golani Brigade, the military said. A fifth IDF soldier had been reported missing, which left the other four dead.

title: Israeli strikes on tent camps near Rafah kill at least 25 , wound 50
message:
Israeli forces have shelled tent camps for displaced Palestinians outside Gaza's southern city of Rafah, killing at least 25 people and wounding another 50, according to the territory's health officials and emergency workers.
The locations of the attacks provided by the Civil Defense and the Red Cross hospital appear to be just outside an Israeli-designated safe zone on the Mediterranean coast, known as Muwasi.
The attack near the Red Cross hospital began with a munition that only made a loud bang and bright flash, said Mona Ashour, who lost her husband after he went to investigate what was happening.
"And then they hit with the second one, which was a little closer to the entrance of the Red Cross," she said.
The hospital's location is known to all parties in the conflict and marked with the Red Cross emblem, the ICRC noted on Friday.

message:

title: Ukraine complains US is limiting strikes in Russia
message:
Officials have denied the claim, with a Pentagon spokesman insisting that Ukraine “has the ability to hit back”.
Washington had been reluctant to allow US missiles to strike Russia because it was worried about escalating the war.
The row over US rules for Ukrainian missile strikes reignited as Russian forces claimed to have used a FAB-3000 M-54 glide bomb, twice the size of its standard FAB-1500 bomb, for the first time in Ukraine.
A video circulating on Telegram showed massive damage to the village of Lyptsi, in the Kharkiv region, after an alleged FAB-3000 glide bomb strike, even though commentary admitted that it had missed its target.
Some Russian military bloggers, though, have been less impressed with the emergence of the FAB-3000 glide bomb.

title: Updated : Russian attacks damage energy infrastructure in multiple oblasts , casualties reported
message:
Russian forces launched missile and drone attacks overnight on June 22, targeting critical energy infrastructure in multiple Ukrainian regions.
Ukraine's Energy Ministry said that energy transmission systems were attacked in southern and western regions of Ukraine, causing damage to equipment.
In Lviv Oblast, a Russian missile struck a energy infrastructure facility causing a fire to break out, Governor Maksym Kozytskyi reported.
In unspecified eastern regions, overhead powerlines were disconnected to "decrease in load on the generating facility," according to Ukraine's Energy Ministry.
As a result of the attacks on energy infrastructure, Ukraine began implementing rolling shutdowns on May 15, but they have dramatically increased in recent days.
event_breakdown: Russian forces launched missile and drone attacks on energy infrastructure in Ukrainian regions overnight on June 22, causing significant damage and leading to the implementation of rolling blackouts across the country. The attacks took place in Lviv Oblast, western Ukraine, and unspecified regions in the east.

title: Likely Yemen Houthi rebel attack targets ship in Gulf of Aden as Eisenhower reportedly heads home
message:
A commercial ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden saw explosions near the vessel, authorities said Saturday, likely the latest attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels attempting to target the shipping lane.
Meanwhile, U.S. officials reportedly ordered the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America's response to the Houthi attacks, to return home.
The captain of the ship targeted late Friday saw "explosions in the vicinity of the vessel," the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The report said an aircraft carrier operating in the Pacific would be taking the Eisenhower's place.
The closest American aircraft carrier known to be operating in Asia is the USS Theodore Roosevelt.

title: Russia Vostok Group Foils Ukraine Attempts to Strengthen Positions
message:
Russia's Vostok Group Foils Ukraine's Attempts to Strengthen Positions - Defense MinistrySputnik News20240621MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Russian servicemen of the Vostok (East) battlegroup of troops disrupted attempts by the Armed Forces of Ukraine to strengthen forward positions, group spokesman Alexander Gordeyev told Sputnik.
"Units of the Vostok group of forces continue to carry out combat missions in the area of the special military operation.
During active operations, the group's units improved the situation along the front line, disrupted attempts by the enemy to reinforce forward positions and rotation in strong points in the areas of Vladimirovka, Makarovka, Marfopol and Charivnoye," Gordeyev said.
He said up to 140 enemy servicemen, two armored combat vehicles, six other vehicles, a towed M198 howitzer, 19 aircraft-type drones and three ammunition supply points were destroyed.

title: Indian Army PARA SF Gets Lethal Edge with Laser Target Designators – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Indian Army’s PARA SF Gets Lethal Edge with Laser Target Designators| BySOURCE: AFIThe Indian Army’s elite PARA Special Forces (SF) have received a significant upgrade in their operational capabilities with the induction of Laser Target Designators (LTDs).
These portable devices mark a game-changer for PARA SF, particularly in dense conflict zones, by enabling them to carry out highly precise strikes on enemy positions.
Upon release, these munitions home in on the reflected laser signature, ensuring pinpoint accuracy and minimal collateral damage.
The deployment of LTDs empowers small PARA SF teams on the ground.
The ability to guide munitions directly to a target provides PARA SF units with a significant tactical advantage.

title: Pro - Iran Iraqi fighter killed in strike on eastern Syria
message:
An Iraqi fighter from an Iran-backed group was killed in an overnight airstrike in eastern Syria near the Iraq border, the group and a war monitor said Saturday.
The strike occurred in Deir Ezzor province, where Iran wields significant influence and which is regularly targeted by Israel and the United States, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.
Since the beginning of the Syrian civil war in 2011, Israel has carried out hundreds of strikes, primarily targeting pro-Iran groups — which it rarely comments on publicly.
In late March, 16 Tehran-affiliated fighters, including an Iranian military adviser, were killed in strikes on eastern Syria.
The strikes also killed one civilian working for the World Health Organization.
event_breakdown: Reports on the latest overnight airstrike that took place in eastern Syria near the Iraq border, targeting an Iraqi fighter from a pro-Iran group. The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights confirmed the incident, displaying the significant influence of Iran in this particular area of Deir Ezzor Province. which has become a target of regular air strikes by both the United States and Israel.

title: Russian media : Ukrainian forces allegedly hit air defense system in Belgorod Oblast
message:
The Ukrainian military has allegedly hit a Pantsir S-1 anti-aircraft missile system in the village of Dubovoe in Belgorod Oblast, Pepel, a media outlet based in the region, claimed on June 22.
Air defense was operating at around 12:20 p.m. in the region, Belgorod Oblast Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov claimed.
Sign upThe Russian media outlet Pepel later claimed that a Pantsir surface-to-air missile system was hit.
Belgorod Oblast borders Ukraine's Sumy, Kharkiv, and Luhansk oblasts.
Claims of missile and drone attacks against the region have recently become a common occurrence after anti-Kremlin Russian militias' incursions into Russian territory.

title: Ukraine complains that United States is limiting missile strikes within Russia
message:
The US gave Ukraine permission to strike targets inside Russia with US-made missiles at the beginning of this month after the Kremlin launched an attack across the border towards Kharkiv.
Washington had been reluctant to allow US missiles to strike Russia because it was worried about escalating the war.
The row over US rules for Ukrainian missile strikes reignited as Russian forces claimed to have used a FAB-3000 M-54 glide bomb, twice the size of its standard FAB-1500 bomb, for the first time in Ukraine.
A video circulating on Telegram showed massive damage to the village of Lyptsi, in the Kharkiv region, after an alleged FAB-3000 glide bomb strike, even though commentary admitted that it had missed its target.
“The strike was not particularly accurate, but the destruction radius of the FAB-3000 will compensate for its lack of accuracy,” it said.

title: Yemen Houthi rebel attack targets a ship in the Gulf of Aden as the Eisenhower reportedly heads home | World News
message:
An attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels targeted a commercial ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden but apparently caused no damage, authorities said Saturday, in the latest strike on the shipping lane by the group.
Meanwhile, US officials reportedly ordered the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America's response to the Houthi attacks, to return home after a twice-extended tour.
The captain of the ship targeted late Friday saw “explosions in the vicinity of the vessel,” the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
Gen. Yahya Saree, a Houthi military spokesman, identified the vessel targeted as the bulk carrier Transworld Navigator.
The Eisenhower had repeatedly been targeted by false attack claims by the Houthis during its time in the Red Sea.
location: The main event is in the Gulf of Aden.

Target event:

event_breakdown: Three people were killed and 38 were injured in a Russian bombing attack on Ukraine’s second city, Kharkiv, on Saturday afternoon. The target was a residential area in Kharkiv's Freedom Square. Russia continues to fire missiles at Ukraine's energy infrastructure, and an overnight attack on a power plant in Lviv killed no one.

title: Russia launches new  massive  attack on Ukraine power network
message:
Russia launched 16 cruise missiles from land, sea and air as well as 13 attack drones, aiming at energy infrastructure in several regions, Ukraine’s military said.
It said it also targeted warehouses containing munitions and “air-launched weapons provided to the Ukrainian military by western countries”.
The Ukrainian energy ministry said this was Russia’s “eighth massive, combined attack on energy infrastructure facilities” in the past three months, targeting the southern Zaporizhzhia region and Lviv in the west.
Russian attacks have destroyed half of Ukraine’s energy capacity, according to President Volodymyr Zelensky.
The head of Russian authorities in the Donetsk region, Denis Pushilin, said the separatist-controlled city of Donetsk and the nearby town of Gorlivka had come under heavy attack from Ukraine.

title: Israel strike kills Ayman Ghatma Hamas terrorist  weapons supplier  Khiara 25 miles inside Lebanon
message:
A high-profile Hamas terrorist was killed in an airstrike in Lebanon’s Bekaa district, Israeli media reported on Saturday.
At least 42 people were also killed in separate Israeli attacks on districts of Gaza City in the north of the Palestinian enclave on Saturday, the director of the Hamas-run government media office said.
The Gaza strikes were reportedly also aimed at assassinating a senior Hamas leader.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) released a video of the drone strike that killed Ayman Ghatma, a Hamas terrorist, as he travelled in a car near the town of Khiara, some 25 miles from the Israeli border.
Lebanese media showed an image of the blackened wreckage of the vehicle, still in flames.

title: Israels raids on refugee camps , houses kill over 100 in 24 hours in Gaza
message:
Israeli troops have carried out yet another massacre in the Gaza Strip, killing at least 101 people in refugee camps and residential areas over the past 24 hours, the Health Ministry says.
One airstrike on houses in the al-Shati refugee camp killed 24 people on Saturday, according to the director of the Gaza media office.
Another 18 Palestinians were also killed in a strike on houses in the al-Tuffah neighborhood, said Ismail al-Thawabta.
The regime’s forces, the Health Ministry said, killed at least 101 Palestinians and wounded 169 in the latest 24-hour reporting period.
This is the highest daily death toll in Gaza since the regime’s forces killed at least 274 Palestinians in an attack on the al-Nuseirat refugee camp on June 8.

title: Detectives nab suspect in fatal stabbing of 40 - year - old man in Manhattan subway station : police
message:
A 24-year-old man has been arrested for the fatal stabbing of a well-liked musician and fashionista during a clash at a Manhattan subway station, cops said Saturday.
Diego Figueroa-Hepner faces murder and weapons possession charges in the deadly attack on 40-year-old Johnny Medina near the turnstiles at the 175th St. A train subway station in Washington Heights around 5:55 p.m. Friday, cops said.
When they reached the mezzanine, Figueroa-Hepner flashed a knife and lunged at Medina, viciously stabbing him repeatedly in the chest and neck, cops said.
Medina was a popular musician and fashion enthusiast known as “J McFly” in the community, said his friend, Alberto Frozani.
“He was a designer, a real fashionista.”Frozani said he was shocked as paramedics carried his dying friend out of the subway station and into an ambulance.

title: Likely Yemen Houthi Rebel Attack Targets Ship in Gulf of Aden as Eisenhower Reportedly Heads Home
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A commercial ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden saw explosions near the vessel, authorities said Saturday, likely the latest attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels attempting to target the shipping lane.
Meanwhile, U.S. officials reportedly ordered the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America's response to the Houthi attacks, to return home.
The captain of the ship targeted late Friday saw “explosions in the vicinity of the vessel,” the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The Houthis, who have held Yemen's capital, Sanaa, since 2014, did not immediately claim the attack.
The Houthis have maintained that their attacks target ships linked to Israel, the United States or Britain.

title: The parts of North Wales that double as Westeros in new House of the Dragon series
message:
Let your watch begin with our House of the Dragon newsletterNorth Wales has a starring role in the second series of House of the Dragon, currently airing on TV.
The show’s executive producer Kevin de la Noy later gave North Wales the thumbs-up.
With North Wales doubling as Westeros, the island of Anglesey provided several key filming location.
Much can be said of the rest of North Wales, with Gwynedd and Conwy standing in for some of the grander – and bloodier – locations.
Yr Eifl Quarry, also known as Trefor Quarry, is thought to have stood in as Dragonstone Castle, ancestral seat of House Targaryen.

title: CVMA 27 - 2 Bull Run III - 96 . 9 The Rock
message:
This year Bull Run III is CVMA 27-2’s 13th annual fundraiser which will be held on July 20th, 2024 starting and finishing at Full Distance Brewing in Stafford, VA.
The first major battle of the American Civil War was the First Battle of Bull Run, the Second Battle of Bull Run occurred just a year later.
As an homage to the warriors that came before us, Bull Run III represents the “the mental Civil War,” the battle within.
All proceeds from our 2024 Bull Run III fundraiser will go to two local 501(c)(3) organizations Willing Warriors and Leashes of Valor:Located in Haymarket, Willing Warriors benefits Veterans by providing cost-free retreat stays and programs that assist wounded and ill service members, disabled veterans, and their families to reconnect.
In fact, Willing Warriors has given several of our own members and their families immeasurable steps towards their path to recovery through a stay at the Warrior Retreat.

for 37 years is being honored with a Forever stamp.
